title: Germany, the preferred refuge for Ukrainian exiles
summary: The country is home to more than one million Ukrainian refugees, many hoping to settle there permanently, despite the difficulties of integrating into the job market.

title: On board a rescue flight evacuating sick and wounded young Gazans to Abu Dhabi
summary: Last week, some 200 Palestinians who managed to escape from the coastal enclave flew to hospitals in the United Arab Emirates. Among them were children hurt by Israeli bombings or suffering from serious illnesses.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine's victory 'depends on you, the Western world'
summary: The Ukrainian president also told a press conference on Sunday that 31,000 troops had been killed in the two years of war. For the first time,  he suggested that Russia had prior information on the country's counteroffensive last summer.

title: Paris 2024: Normandy hopes for an Olympic boost by hosting foreign sports delegations
summary: Cities in the northern French region will host athletes ahead of the Olympic Games. They are hoping for direct economic and promotional benefits.

title: In South Korea, a doctors' strike creates chaos in hospitals
summary: Doctors and interns are protesting against the relaxing of the strict entry requirements to medical school in an aging country suffering from a shortage of personnel. The government has had to open military hospitals to civilians.

title: Elena Kostyuchenko, Russian journalist in exile: 'Now we can only count on ourselves'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Russian journalist and opponent of the Putin regime talks about her work in Ukraine documenting the abuses committed by Russian forces and her hopes for the future of her country.

title: Gérard Depardieu faces new sex assault complaint
summary: The French actor, 75, has been charged with rape in another case and has been accused of sexual harassment and assault by more than a dozen women. He denies the allegations.

title: Patrick Artus: 'How to overcome the eurozone's limitations'
summary: The economist explains that if Europe's balance of payments surplus continues to be invested outside Europe, the eurozone will no longer be able to end the vicious circle of lack of productivity.

title: Between heckles and clashes, Macron spends 13 hours trying to maintain peace at France's big agriculture fair
summary: Keeping his distance from the angry farmers protesting at the Salon de l'Agriculture in Paris, the French president spent a long day meeting producers and talking with unions as he defended the government's response to the farming community's demands.

title: Six Nations: Italy holds France to 13-13 draw in frustrating match
summary: Les Bleus' performance on Sunday will do little to ease the pressure on heavily criticized coach Fabien Galthié. France is now fourth in the standings with Wales away and England at home to come.

title: In South Carolina, Donald Trump continues his winning streak in the Republican primaries
summary: After Iowa, New Hampshire and Nevada, the former president pulled off a spectacular quadruple victory, confirming his overwhelming dominance among the Republican base.

title: EU accession negotiations: Ukraine can wait
summary: European elections in June, followed by the Hungarian Presidency of the EU Council, have led the 27 member states to postpone the opening of talks with Kyiv.

title: Belarus President Lukashenko announces he will seek re-election next year
summary: Lukashenko was speaking on Sunday as polls opened in Belarus's  tightly controlled parliamentary and local elections that are set to cement his rule, despite calls for a boycott from the opposition.

title: Half of Western military aid to Ukraine delivered late, says defense minister
summary: 'At the moment, commitment does not constitute delivery,' Rustem Umerov said on Sunday at a forum to mark the second anniversary of the Russian invasion.

title: War in Ukraine: Education, an additional cog in Moscow's war machine
summary: Imitations of military parades, fancy dress uniforms and weapons for younger children: Russia's new forced school curriculum is testing children's, and their parents', loyalty.

title: Berlinale 2024: Mati Diop's restitution documentary 'Dahomey' wins Golden Bear for Best Film
summary: Diop's taut, dreamlike film traces the 2021 journey home of 26 precious artifacts of the Dahomey kingdom to Benin from a Paris museum.

title: 'Oppenheimer' wins top prizes at 30th Screen Actors Guild Awards
summary: The SAG Awards, one of the most-telling Oscar predictors, will only add to the momentum for Christophe Nolan's movie, the lead Academy Awards nominee with 13 nods.

title: 'Before I went into IT, I thought that the boys were going to be better than me, that they'd have logic that I don't have'
summary: 'First times': tales of pivotal moments around the transition to adulthood. This week, Tess, 24, describes her daily life pursuing a professional certification in computer science, where she is the only woman in both her class and company.

title: After two years of war, Ukraine's unity is being tested
summary: The more time passes, the greater the gap grows between those who are participating in the war effort and those who appear not to be doing enough. The law on mobilization, currently debated in Parliament, is particularly divisive.

title: Israel's army proposes an evacuation plan for civilians in Gaza
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said a ground invasion of the Palestinian territory's southern city Rafah was necessary for "total victory."

title: The letters from two Ukrainian sisters: 'After two years of war, we are all in a state of dazed confusion'
summary: Olga and Sasha Kurovska, two Ukrainian sisters, one of whom lives in Paris and the other in Kyiv, kept a diary for a year in Le Monde. The pair shared a personal account of how their daily lives were disrupted by the war. They now give updates about their lives in the form of regular correspondence.

title: Cycling, a cheap and effective medicine
summary: A study has shown that cycling is a good way to prevent chronic diseases and lower premature mortality, with substantial savings for health insurance institutions and the community.

title: Tens of thousands of Bolsonaro supporters protest to defend Brazil's former president against investigations
summary: "What I seek is pacification, it is erasing the past," Bolsonaro said in a speech in Sao Paulo on Sunday, and he denied that he and his supporters attempted a coup when rioters assaulted government buildings in 2023.

title: Ukrainian as a language of resistance: 'When I hear Russian, it makes me want to vomit'
summary: Since the invasion, thousands of Ukrainians have abandoned the Russian language, associating it with war crimes. This is a shift on an unprecedented scale.

title: Cancellations of surgeries and C-sections... South Korea urges doctors to return to work as protests continue
summary: Thousands of junior doctors have resigned and stopped showing up to work as part of a spiraling action against government plans to sharply increase medical school admissions in the face of shortages plus a rapidly aging society.

title: Two years of war in Ukraine: A catastrophic effect on demographics
summary: The country's birth rate has collapsed. The separation of couples, with millions of women and children leaving the country, has been compounded by male mortality.

title: Gastronomy: London calling
summary: From 'gastro pubs' to Michelin-starred restaurants, between the influence of celebrity chefs and world cuisine, London's culinary scene has taken a spectacular leap forward. And even porridge is no longer frightening.

title: Japanese moon lander revives and communicates with base
summary: After a two-week lunar night, the Smart Lander for Investigating Moon (SLIM) unit managed to regain function and carry out observations of a crater, despite its landing having left its solar panels misaligned, sparking fears that it would not reawaken.

title: Australian helicopter pilot and 2 workers freed from kidnapping in Papua New Guinea
summary: Amid an upsurge in violence between rival clans in Papua New Guinea's highlands, a helicopter pilot from Australia – a key security Papuan ally – and 2 others, believed to be telecom workers, had been kidnapped, but are now 'safe and unharmed.'

title: Ukraine allies meet for conference in Paris
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron is hosting leaders and representatives of Ukraine's allies on Monday to 'reaffirm their unity' and 'determination.'

title: The Basmati rice war between India and Pakistan
summary: India, the world's leading Basmati exporter, was overtaken by Pakistan in Europe but retaliated by registering a protected geographical indication. The two countries, enemies since 1947, are also at odds over the origin of the famous fragrant grain.

title: Despite legal charges, Bolsonaro is as popular as ever with his base
summary: The far-right former president gathered tens of thousands of supporters in Sao Paolo on Sunday. Accused of attempting to overturn the outcome of the 2022 elections, he faces imprisonment.

title: French journalist detained in Ethiopia, says employer
summary: The publication Africa Intelligence said its journalist Antoine Galindo has been detained since Thursday on 'spurious accusations' of conspiring 'to create chaos.'
